title.narrative: Iraq Customs and Border Control Program

description.narrative: This initiative supports the Iraq Customs and Border Control program to build the capacity of Iraq's customs and quarantine agencies. Building the skills of Iraq's border control agencies will contribute to Iraq's broader efforts to reduce poverty. A transparent, rules-based excise and border control regime will assist Iraq's transition into a market based economy and facilitate trade and economic growth. A robust, professional quarantine service will protect Iraq's vital agricultural sector from pests and diseases, while also improving food security by facilitating the import of essential agricultural inputs and food items. An efficient excise regime will also provide a stable, alternative source of taxation to unpredictable oil revenues, providing greater predictability for the Government of Iraq to plan spending on infrastructure and essential services. The total value of this initiative is $7.5 million over 3 years, starting 2008-09.
